info.title: Adi Insights
info.description:
Welcome to the Adi API. Once you have an Adi authorization key, you can use this API to access information about staff, locations, jobs and shifts (scheduled, timesheets and approved hours). Additionally you can send in 'Point of Sales' information.

If you are looking from some hands-on access to the API we recommend using Insomnia (https://insomnia.rest/). Within Insomnia you can import the Adi API spec by clicking on the Download Open API specification.

When you are asking for a list of staff, shifts, jobs, locations or anything else available via the API, the response will be paginated. The default is 100 items per page, however, you should not rely on this for determining if there is another page. You should use the URL provided in the “next” and “previous” fields in the response.

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description: Jobs are tasks that staff perform at locations.

tags.name: Locations
tags.description: Locations are physical areas that require staff to be stationed.

tags.name: Scheduled Shifts
tags.description: These are the times that are planned for staff to be at a location.

tags.name: Timesheets
tags.description: These are the recorded times that staff occupied a location.

tags.name: Approved Shifts
tags.description: These are the times that have been approved and will be used in payroll.

tags.name: Stats
tags.description: Location statistics to assist with accurate scheduling.

tags.name: Batch Processor
tags.description: Check the status of a batch processor task. These will often be when the creation of multiple objects has been triggered. The results will be ordered in the same order you submitted them.

get.description: Retrieve shifts that have been approved by a manager. Without any parameters, all approved shifts from the last 30 days are returned. Filters can be applied to refine the search
Get a list of configured integrations

200.description: Successfully retrieved a list of configured integrations

get.description: Get a list of linked locations for the integration

200.description: Successfully retrieved a list of linked locations

get.description: Get a list of linked staff for the integration

200.description: Successfully retrieved a list of linked staff

get.description: By default this will return all leave overlapping today

post.description: If you are creating leave spanning multiple days send the start as midnight of the starting day and finish as midnight at the end of the last day. For example, if you are on leave for both the 7th and 8th of April 2020 send the start as "2020-04-07T00:00:00+09:30" and the finish as "2020-04-09T00:00:00+09:30" If you are creating a multi-day leave event not starting or finishing at midnight, divide this into multiple full and part day events.

location.description: If not provided the staff member's primary location will be used

parameters.name: data_type
parameters.description: Is this data predicted or what actually occured?

parameters.name: data_type
parameters.description: Is this data predicted or what actually occured?

parameters.name: stat_type
parameters.description: Either a monetary amount (sales) or a count of some item

get.description: Retrieve actual (or predicted) sales (or units) for a location. If a date range is not provided, the current weeks stats are returned. Filters can be applied to refine the search

post.description: Create actual (or predicted) sales (or units) for a location.

get.description: Retrieve the details of a timesheet
Locations can be grouped together. Retrieve all such groups.
Retrieve scheduled shifts. Without any parameters, all published scheduled shifts from the last 30 days are returned. Filters can be applied to refine the search

Retrieve the details of all staff. Without any parameters, only employed staff are returned.
To retrieve staff that have been terminated, the 'employment_status' parameter must be set to 'terminated'.
Australian financial detail fields (Bank Account, Supperanuation Fund and Tax File Number Declaration) will only be included if specifically requested.

Retrieve the details of a staff member.
Australian financial detail fields (Bank Account, Supperanuation Fund and Tax File Number Declaration) will only be included if specifically requested.
Retrieve timesheet shifts. Without any parameters all timesheets from the last 30 days are returned. Filters can be applied to refine the search

location.description: If not provided the staff member's primary location will be used

address.example: 1 Test Street, New York, NY, United States

items.description: The UUID of jobs that are available to this location

source.description: Source of the clock event, may contain other strings for external POS systems

items.description: The UUID of locations that this staff member is available to work at
The UUID of locations that this staff member is available to work at

finish.description: Non inclusive ISO 8601 date time with timezone

manual.description: Stat manually entered by a user

finish.description: Non inclusive ISO 8601 date time with timezone

detail.example: Foo is an invalid query parameter
You do not have permission to perform this action

batch.name: batch_id
batch.description: The id of the batch processor task

greaterThan.name: gt
greaterThan.description: Return results where the 'start' field is greater than this value.

greaterThanOrEqual.name: gte
greaterThanOrEqual.description: Return results where the 'start' field is greater than or equal this value.

lessThan.name: lt
lessThan.description: Return results where the 'start' field is less than this value.

lessThanOrEqual.name: lte
lessThanOrEqual.description: Return results where the 'start' field is less than or equal this value.

locationgroup.name: loc_group
locationgroup.description: Return results that belong to this location group

overlapping.description: Return results overlapping the period `gt` to `lt`
overlapping.name: overlapping

publish_status.name: status
publish_status.description: Filter shifts by published status. If not provided only published shifts will be returned.

Basic.description: Authenitcate with the credentials provided by Adi Support (api@adiinsights.com)
